p: Rašković et al. identified in R. officinalis essential oils 1,8-cineole (43.77%), camphor (12.53%), α-pinene (11.51%), β-pinene (8.16%), and camphene (4.55%) as the main constituents [ 38]. A lower concentration of 1,8-cineol (18.7–21.6%) was described by Ojeda-Sana et al. [ 34]. Touati et al. quantified the main components in the essential oil of L. dentata leaves, 1,8-cineole (33.54%) and camphor (18.9%) [ 39].
